bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Arlington and Johnson. Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the matter of the application of Timothy Johnson for a writ of Habeas Corpus}
The Hon. John P. Hoyt. Judge of the District Court of the Second Judicial District.
The Petition of Timothy Johnson of the City of Tacoma Labourer.

That your Petition is unlawfully unprisouned, detained, confound, and restrained of his liberty by Lewis Byrd. Sheriff of Pierce County Washington Territory, at the County jail in the city of Tacoma in Pierce County Washington Territory.

That your Petitioner was arrested on the 23rd day of January AD 1885 and charged by one in Brotton with the offered in the complaint filed before A.E. Lawrence Esq. or Justice of
the Peace in and for Pierce County Washington Territory a copy of which complaint to warned "A" and gave Petitioner has been in the Custody of the said sheriff since the evening of that day.
The said imprisonment detention and confinement are illegal and confinement are illegal and the illegality thereof consists in this to out.
1. That there was us legal lending to show that gave Petitioner had committed the misdemeanor charged in on said Complaint.

2. That there was no legal evidence whatever, before the said Justice upon which he could base a conclusion on opinion that there was probable cause for behaving the defendant guilty of the misdemeanor charged in the said complaint.

3. That the said Justice while he that there was no evidence adduced showing that
your Petitioner had visited the House of said Arlington for the purpose of smoking or inhaling opium, or that he had ever smoked or inhaled opium: or that he had been found in the forsesseen of an opium pipe or pipes, heed that the mere fact of four Petitioner being found in as house in which there was also an opium pipe found was evidence on which he said Justice was bound to commit four Petitioners to await his trial at the set settings of the District Court.
4. That the said sheriff has no legal authority for restraining your complainant of his liberty.
5. That your petitioner is not guilty as charged in the said complaint.
Wherefore your Petitioner frags that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said Lewis Byrd commanding him to have the body of your Petitioner before your storm at a hence and place
